intro: Lagenaria bicornuta, commonly known as the two-horned bottle gourd, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and squash. The plant produces large, elongated fruits that can grow up to several feet in length. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, while its flowers are typically yellow and borne in clusters. The fruit is often used in culinary and medicinal applications due to its versatile properties.
